There are a few things that need to happen in order to get Log Hound up and running on your page.  The examples page in the repository can be used as a hard example of how to include and turn on Log Hound, but here's a more in-depth instruction.

===Simple===
This is the the base, no frills install example:
{{{
1   <link href="/styles/loghound.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
2   <script type="text/javascript" src="/js/loghound.js"></script>
3   function onBodyLoad() {
4       window.logHound.doSetup();
5   }
6   </script>
7   <body onLoad="onBodyLoad();">
}}}

 * 1) Link in the style sheet.
 * 2) Include the Log Hound code.
 * 3-6) Create a function for the body onLoad event that calls Log Hound's doSetup() function.
 * 7) Make sure to call the body onLoad function!

===More Complex===
{{{
1   <link href="/styles/loghound.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
2   <script type="text/javascript" src="/js/loghound.js"></script>
3
4   <script type="text/javascript">
5   function loghoundControl() {
6       var loghoundSwitch = document.getElementById('lhKillSwitch').value;
7       window.logHound.setKillSwitch(!(loghoundSwitch!=null && loghoundSwitch=='on'));
8   }
9   function onBodyLoad() {
10      loghoundControl();
11      window.logHound.doSetup();
12  }
13  </script>
14  <body onLoad="onBodyLoad();">
15  <input type="hidden" id="lhKillSwitch" name="lhKillSwitch" value="on" />
}}}
